text: Sir Isaac Wilson MD FRS FRSE (1757-1844) was a British physician who served as physician to the Duke and Duchess of Kent and was Director of the Haslar Naval Hospital. ==Life== In 1816 he became a Fellow of the Medico Chirurgical Society and is listed as "Domestic Physician to the Duchess of Kent.Medico- Chirurgical Transactions vol.27 He was also senior physician at the Naval Hospital in Plymouth.United Services Magazine 1845 In 1831 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of London and in 1834 was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposer for the latter was Alexander Copland Hutchison. He retired as head physician of Haslar Naval Hospital in Portsmouth in 1840. This position was seen as a "prize" amongst naval surgeons and other holders included Nelson's personal physician, Sir William Beatty.Lancet 1840 vol 2 He lived at Fareham in Hampshire. He died in BognorThe Gentleman's Magazine vol 177 on 2 December 1844. His will is held in the National Archive at Kew.https://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/details/r/D90994 ==References== Category:1757 births Category:1844 deaths Category:19th-century British medical doctors Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Fellows of the Royal Society of Edinburgh
title: Isaac Wilson (physician)
